职位描述

\xa0

这是个令人兴奋和具有挑战性的职位，适合那些愿意加入一个快速成长、潜在的世界级的中国公司担任法律部门负责人的应聘者。

\xa0

担任这一职位的主要职责之一是负责中国和全球法务部的顺利运作； 制定和实施全面的内部政策和程序，以保障公司的正常和成功运作； 评估和控制日常运营和战略项目可能带来的潜在风险；处理潜在的诉讼和争议事宜；沟通战略技术许可协议的相关事宜并支持中国乃至全球的营销和业务发展计划。

\xa0

候选人将负有主要的项目管理和战略规划职责，并为公司高层管理人员和其他业务职能部门提供持续的法律咨询和建设性意见。

  6. 通英文和中文（普通话） 优

选资格 熟

Job description

We're looking for someone who knows digital. You probably won't know how to code because although you're interested in all things digital, you will know your limitations. You're all over the concepts and can talk to clients about them in plain English.

This means someone who knows the difference between CMS and CSS. Can talk about API's and when they'd be used. Has a good understanding of SEO, Google Analytics and Email Marketing. You'll know what a sub domain is and that an IP address has nothing to do with intellectual property. You'll be responsive and expect your websites to be the same.

You're a switched on super-fast learner who's organised, creative yet still practical. You're unique and choose not to fall into the trap of using buzz phrases like "reach out", "deep dive" or "circle back". You have a genuine sense of urgency and while you have a passion for cutting red tape, you're no cowboy.

835984956:
[

Consultant - Property / Asbestos / Hazardous Materials x2 - VIC

Company Name Greencap Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Permanent opportunity x2 roles based in Kew, VIC with convenient office location!

  • Join the largest Risk Management Company based in Australia and New Zealand

  • Ongoing training and mentoring to support your career development!


Greencap is the largest integrated risk management and compliance company in Australia and New Zealand delivering Work Health and Safety, Property and Environmental risk management solutions.Greencap service thousands of private and government clients in the education, property, resources, industrial, manufacturing, retail and services sectors.Greencap partners with clients to understand their needs, allowing us to deliver tailored risk management solutions that protect our client’s most valued assets; their People, Property and Environment.


With over 300 professional, technical and engineering employees based in 9 offices across Australia and New Zealand, we are now seeking to appoint 2x experienced Property / Asbestos / Hazardous Materials Consultants to join our Property Hazmat team based at our Head Office in Kew, VIC.


The Role:


Due to recent internal promotions, these roles have become vacant and is suitable for someone who has a strong interest in building a career in a Consulting role which focusses on risk management in the WHS and hazardous materials sector. You will report to the Team Manager and be supported by a team of high performing industry experts. Your responsibilities will be as follows, but not limited to:


Key responsibilities:



  • Conducting asbestos / Hazmat audits in a wide range of locations including commercial buildings, industrial facilities and residential properties.

  • Conducting a full range of compliance air monitoring, bulk sampling including during asbestos / hazmat removal projects.

  • Drafting reports and recommending hazardous materials and asbestos risk mitigation and management strategies as well as drafting management plans.

  • Providing appropriate and relevant information to senior consultants who are responsible for completing reports.

  • Developing and maintaining hazardous materials and asbestos registers coupled with supervising removal programs.

  • Completing assigned projects within the timeframe to ensure they meet defined project objectives.

  • Maintaining existing client relationships to expand regional business opportunities and services via proactive consultancy.


Ideally you have the following skills and attributes:



  • Minimum 2 years’ experience in surveying and fibre counting or graduate with knowledge in hazardous materials or asbestos management along with an understanding of WH&S, consulting and risk management would be advantageous.

  • Experience in client communication along with providing reports and recommendations.

  • An ability to develop, maintain and strengthen business partnerships as well as work cooperatively and collaboratively with others to achieve collective goals.

  • Eagerness to learn with a strong interest in building a career in a Consulting role which focusses on risk management in the WHS and hazardous materials sector.

  • Tertiary qualifications in Environmental Science, Health and Safety, Occupational Hygiene Building and Construction or equivalent would be highly desirable.

  • Qualified Licensed Asbestos Assessor (LAA) and previous experience working in a NATA accredited laboratory will be highly regarded.


What we offer You:



  • A great career within Greencap, a division of our highly regarded ASX Top 20 Wesfarmers parent company!

  • A career building opportunity and support provided to you to enhance your skills, professional development and achieve the success you desire!

  • Access to structured training (become Certified in LAA) and development opportunities in not only hazardous materials but also in range of other services which we offer - occupational hygiene, environment and property risk.

  • Diverse range of work that challenges and stimulates across varied industries and in many different regions.

  • Flexible work environment within a strong team and collegial inclusive culture.

  • A competitive salary package commensurate with your capability and experience

  • Participation in Wesfarmers share plan and range of other employee benefits!


This role requires flexibility as it will have possible weekends/weeknights with occasional work in country locations, a full driver’s licence with own reliable vehicle is also essential.


We are on the cusp of an ambitious growth and change phase. It’s an exciting time to build your career with Greencap!


Click the ‘Apply’ button below and follow the links to submit your covering letter and CV. To apply you must be an Australian/New Zealand resident orable to work without restriction in Australia.


Applications close: Sunday, 16 September 2018


WIS promotes and adheres to the principles and practices of diversity

Contact the job poster

Lisa Thompson

Talent Acquisition Lead

Sydney, Australia

827484626:
[

Australia Logistics Manager

Company Name Who Gives a Crap Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 114 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

A bit about us

Who Gives a Crap sells good looking, forest friendly toilet paper, paper towels, and tissues and we donate 50% of our profits to help build toilets for those in need. As much as we love toilet paper, the reason we’re in business is the impact we’re having on the world—to date we’ve donated more than $1 million to help fund sanitation projects in developing countries. Woohoo! We’re incredibly proud of this, but there’s a lot more work to do and toilet paper to sell...


We’ve been running for a few years in Australia, where we’re one of the fastest growing e-commerce businesses, and we’ve just recently launched in the US and UK. Here in Melbourne, our first home, we’re building our operations teams, we have other teams in LA, Philippines and China, too! With your help, we'll keep growing with the right people and will be famous around the world in no time!


Operationally, we work with 7 third party warehouses across Australia and more than a dozen carriers shipping tens of thousands of orders every month. We also have 3 warehousing operations across the UK and USA. Phew.


What we want you to do

You will lead our Australian logistics function to ensure it’s running efficiently, effectively and with a high quality of service and performance across the board.


As a super-fast growing business, the challenge is making sure we strike the right balance between robustness and flexibility at the same time. With a mountain of projects on the go, we will look to your hands-on as well as strategic abilities to lead and execute them to success.


This role reports to our Chief Parcel Pusher (global head of logistics) based in Ireland.


You’ll keep things running smoothly:

  • Continue to refine the robustness, efficiency and future potential of our logistics operations by optimising our partners and systems

  • Own the relationship with our Australian-based 3PLs and shipping partners

  • Negotiate and enforce our contracts to keep costs in check and make sure we’re always getting the best bang for our buck with a high quality of service

  • Design and report key metrics to all relevant stakeholders

  • Get your hands dirty - when needed, jump in to fight fires as they appear and ensure steps are taken to reduce the risk of a repeat


Take the lead to ensure we have an efficient and clear workflow and relationship between our Australian Logistics, Customer Happiness and B2B teams

  • Drive regular reviews and lead projects that will continually improve information flows, systems, data capture and reporting

  • Ensure logistics is supporting these teams to execute their priority projects, allocating the right resourcing from the Logistics team

  • Provide the second escalation point for issues raised by our Customer Happiness and B2B teams to Logistics and support our Logistics Coordinator in the day to day challenges to ensure resolution


Be a master builder

  • Help us to future-proof our logistics operations, looking ahead and strategically shaping our operations to cope with the growth objectives of the business

  • Set the direction and priorities for how we continue to shape Australian logistics operations into the future and feed into our global strategy

  • Lead the design, maintenance, and training for logistics tech systems and solutions within the Australian market, pulling in external support as needed

  • Support or lead the execution of ad hoc global or other cross-functional logistics projects as required


Lead the logistics team in Australia:

  • Setting the direction for the team to achieve our team and personal OKR’s and Goals

  • Nurture an inspiring, safe and inclusive team culture

  • Manage the team workload and take the lead on hiring for future growth

  • Provide mentoring and guidance to the team by holding monthly 1on1’s, annual 360 feedback and journey planning session as well as immediate feedback and coaching on performance. We like to keep things super transparent, open and honest and you’ll set that example for your team.


A month in the life

If you were working for us, here are some of the things you would have done in the last month:

  • Lead a due diligence process on a new potential warehouse partner, resulting in a recommendation for sign-off by our Chief Parcel Pusher

  • Facilitated the end to end testing of a new order fulfillment integration system, between our IMS and each of our Australian 3PLs

  • Got your hands dirty, working side by side with the rest of the team to get us through a very rough operational period with one warehouse partner, including overcoming major service level failings, while keeping the wider business in the loop

  • Helped guide a couple of team members through their current round of quarterly goal-setting

  • Started to lay the groundwork for a same-day delivery trial in key cities

  • Tested out our new project management tool with some trial team projects laid out and the team briefed on expectations

  • Kept a close eye on a couple of transport hiccups to ensure the right resolution was enacted

  • Uncovered an unexpected set of charges in some of our shipping invoices and worked through a robust solution with the relevant partner, including resolving some misaligned expectations

  • Worked with our Chief Parcel Pusher to lock-in our team OKRs for the quarter and taken ownership over those relevant to our Australian operations

  • Identified an opportunity to reduce the shipping charges paid by some customers and implemented a change to our rate matrices to enact this


The team(s)

You’ll be part of the Parcel Pushers team which consists of our Chief Parcel Pusher, James who is based in Europe and our Logistics Coordinator, Kate based here with you in Melbourne and a soon-to-be-hired US/UK Logistics Manager based in LA. We also have LOTS of input from customer-facing teams and lots of logistics administration support from our operations administration team in Manila. You’ll also work with the whole company in different ways to come up with new and innovative ideas that really speak to who we are and support the execution of Growth, Tech, Creative, Finance and People projects as needed. We’re a really collaborative bunch, so everyone is encouraged to participate in ideas beyond their ‘job spec’.


Who you are

Experience is amazing, as this is a leadership role it’s ideal that you’ve been on a similar crazy growth journey before and can comfortably guide the team through the change. Above all, we’re looking for a smart problem solver who can learn the ins and outs of our business quickly and embrace opportunities to make an impact.\xa0


Plus, we’ll need to be confident you have the ability to contribute to our culture in a positive way and grow and manage a team. We've broken this down to a few easy bullet points of proven experience we'll be looking out for;\xa0


  • You build strong, commercially savvy, strategic partnerships
  • You are a master collaborator
  • You’re a focused, disciplined and super organised leader
  • You’re proactive, curious and autonomous
  • You’re data and tech-obsessed

Why you should work with us

Every minute you spend working with us, you’re making a difference. The better service we can provide to our customers, the more likely they return and the bigger an impact we’ll have. Sell your soul no longer! We think that’s a pretty great perk, but we don’t stop there...


Working for a startup is exciting, varied and if you have a great idea, we’ll do everything we can to make it happen. The job is also amazingly flexible, something we’re working hard to hold onto even as we grow super quickly. While we’ll spend a few days a week together in our shared space in Melbourne you can also mix it up and work in your PJ’s from home or set up office at the beach, up to you! And while we don’t have a Friday drinks cart (yet), you will get free toilet paper. A lot of it. And nothing beats that.


Lastly, you get to say the word ‘crap’ more than in any other job. Guaranteed.


Compensation

This depends on your experience but just because we’re a profit-for-purpose business doesn’t mean you’ll get paid peanuts. Think chocolate covered macadamia nuts with some extra perks thrown in. In other words, we pay competitively and are determined to make this the best job you'll ever have – you won’t ever want to leave!


On top of 20 days annual leave, Who Gives A Crap also provides flexibility to take extra unpaid leave or travel while working, we provide a health insurance stipend, generous maternity and paternity leave and a whole lot of other stuff. And did we mention the free toilet paper?


To apply

Ok, enough about us. Apply before September 12th – and please include your CV along your responses to the questions on our application page. Interesting, honest and creative responses will serve you well. Oh, and a joke would be nice too—it makes the review process more fun!

Job description

Our client is seeking a Scientist in Charge - Molecular Pathology Infections and Viral Bacteria.


Job Description\xa0

\xa0

In collaboration with the Operations Manager, Pathologists, Clinical Directors and Quality Managers this role provides leadership and direction to the Molecular pathology laboratory.


The Head of Department is responsible for planning, coordinating and managing the Molecular pathology laboratory operations for their department.


This includes the day-to-day organisation, training of all departmental staff, including competency review and performance of pathology tests within the department.


The Head of Department must also be an expert in the Molecular specialty.

The role assumes responsibility for both clerical and technical aspects of the day-to-day work being performed including the supervision of scientists, technicians and laboratory assistants and ensuring departmental KPIs are met.


The Head of Department is required to ensure that all accreditation requirements are met and also extends to providing supervision and scientific support to branch laboratories.


There is also career advancement opportunities for the best candidate who demonstrate strong leadership qualities.


This role will particularly suit a mature, self-sufficient operator used to juggling priorities. \xa0 We are seeking someone with the best combination of:


Personal


Demonstrated highly developed written and verbal communication skills and a proven ability to communicate with a wide variety of personnel.


Integrity and professional self-awareness.


Self-motivated and innovative with a focus on achievement.


Strong customer service focus.


Time management skills, experience in working under tight deadlines to meet day to day targets, with the capacity to manage multiple tasks within set timeline.


Vocational


Demonstrated management and leadership ability.


Scientist with a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a Pathology environment.


Possess the theoretical and practical ability to perform complex laboratory techniques.

Tertiary Degree in Medical Laboratory Science or equivalent

Team Assistant- Boutique corporate advisory firm

Company Name Vesparum Capital Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Job description

The Company

Vesparum Capital is a data-driven advisory company transforming the capital markets landscape. We provide independent capital markets advice to companies and their shareholders to optimise their interactions with the equity capital markets. Our team brings together a unique combination of industry experience and technical expertise in investment banking, management consulting and data science. We work in true partnership with our clients to provide objective and conflict-free advice that maximises long term shareholder value.

\xa0

The Role

The team assistant role will provide you with an exciting opportunity to manage the day to day running of a busy professional services firm experiencing rapid growth. Responsibilities will include:

\xa0

  • Assistance with client communications
  • Management of internal and external client meetings, events and catering
  • Diary and agenda management
  • Coordination of domestic and international travel
  • Liaise with vendors, contractors & building management
  • Procure and maintain office supplies and equipment
  • Manage and process staff reimbursements and expenses
  • Maintain internal filing systems
  • Assistance in on-boarding of new employees
  • Matter of course printing, binding and scanning
  • Assisting senior executives with reasonable personal errands
  • Management of incoming and outgoing office mail & other correspondence
  • Potential to assist with generating, building and sharing social media content
  • Any other ad-hoc tasks as necessary

\xa0

Our rapidly growing team currently consists of approx. 20 people working in a professional open plan environment. We have a fun culture where work-life balance is a key focus.


Experience & Skills

  • 2-3 years’ experience working in a corporate office environment (preferred but not essential)
  • Working knowledge of Microsoft office
  • Strong organizational and multitasking skills
  • Strong oral and written communication skills
  • Exceptional phone etiquette and articulation
  • Approachable and flexible attitude
  • High level of integrity and strong ethics
  • Open minded, resourceful, energetic and friendly personality
  • Excellent interpersonal skills
  • Ability to maintain a professional manner and high level of self-presentation
  • Fluent English written and verbal communication skills

\xa0

This is a fantastic opportunity not to be missed by applicants looking to further their experience in the corporate world with clear career advancement opportunities and a competitive compensation and benefits package including 6 weeks of paid annual leave.

We place a high degree of importance on finding the right person for each position. We work towards this by creating a flexible and inclusive work environment that helps our team reach their full potential.


If this sounds like you, please send a copy of your cover letter and CV in PDF format to careers@vesparum.com

Job description

Are you a Sales Star with excellent medical device and consumables sales experience? Are you looking for an opportunity to broaden your experience and be part of a fast-growing dynamic team? This could be the ideal next step for you.


Our hospital team is seeking a dynamic sales professional to join our team as Territory Manager. Our team is responsible for a range of products utilised in the field of anaesthesia and the clinical setting.


You will be developing growth strategies and sales plans with our Sales Manager in Victoria and Tasmania. You will partake in local and national events to develop new business opportunities and drive continued sales growth.


The primary focus of this role is supporting a range of established products and developing sales for new agencies and if applicable new customer segments with our Sales Manager. You will have superb presentation and communicating skills as you will be delivering sales messaging and delivering product training to Clinicians. Your ability to influence, persuade and travel interstate is integral to your success in this role.


To secure this role you will ideally hold a sales qualification and 5 – 10 year’s experience in medical device or pharmaceutical sales. You will have a positive attitude, be able to work as part of a team and autonomously, while able to approach tasks with an action oriented attitude. You will need to be a self-starter and your ability to quickly absorb new product information and excellent communication skills will be a real asset.
